Israel's D9 bulldozer, a tool of destruction in Gaza
subhead: Imported by the dozens from the United States, Israel has redesigned Caterpillar D9 bulldozers to play a dual strategic and political role: protecting soldiers entering Gaza and leveling the enclave.

Captain Filimonov, a leading figure of Ukrainian resistance in the Donbas
subhead: The 30-year-old officer, a former activist in the Maidan revolution in 2014, commands the 108th Assault Battalion of the 59th Brigade. He succeeded Dmytro Kotsiubailo, known as 'Da Vinci,' as head of the unit – the first volunteer to be awarded the title of 'Hero of Ukraine.'

title: Pope Leo XIV to visit Turkey and Lebanon on his first papal trip
subhead: On his debut on the international stage, the head of the Catholic Church will celebrate the 1,700th anniversary of the Council of Nicaea on Lake Iznik, at the invitation of the Patriarch of Constantinople. The stop in Lebanon gives him the opportunity to send a message to a region in crisis.

title: With 'Bugonia,' Yorgos Lanthimos revisits contemporary America through the lens of conspiracy theories
subhead: The Greek film director delivers a darkly comedic fable in which a CEO is kidnapped by two men convinced that she is an extraterrestrial.

title: Germany's pension reform becomes a generational conflict
subhead: The plan agreed upon by coalition members is to maintain pension levels despite the aging population. But it is opposed by young conservatives, who are calling for more sweeping reforms.

Four reasons French winegrowers are angry
subhead: Wine production in 2025 is expected to match that of 2024, which was already a disastrous year. Le Monde examines the four main factors behind this downturn.

title: Paris shops are squeezed by overtourism and real estate speculation
subhead: Between the needs of residents and the desire to attract tourists, commerces in the French capital have to strike a delicate balance. Failing to do so can be detrimental, as seen by the decline of the BHV department store.

title: Kirill Dmitriev, Putin's loyal intermediary, plays a central role in Trump's Ukraine plan
subhead: The banker has emerged as the key intermediary between the Kremlin and the White House, co-authoring – alongside US President Donald Trump's special envoy, Steve Witkoff, himself a prominent figure in the business world – a draft peace agreement that is sharply tilted in Moscow's favor.
